image.altText: Caboolture plane crash

items.synopsis: A man and a woman have died after a collision between two aircraft at Caboolture Airfield.

title.children: Man and woman in their 60s killed as planes collide north of Brisbane

image.altText: A man in a hair salon chair holds up dreadlocks that have been cut off.

items.synopsis: Christopher Mark Jordan, 36, appears in a Launceston court accused of murdering a Tasmanian teen after the discovery of human remains in bushland this week.

title.children: Man accused of murdering teen Shyanne-Lee Tatnell named in first court appearance

image.altText: Karen, a middle-aged woman wearing a pink jumper, smiles.

items.synopsis: A cure for hepatitis C was introduced in 2016, but experts say too few people are accessing it. Karen, who used to suffer from the illness, wants that to change.

title.children: Treatment for hepatitis C used to be 'unbearable', but now there's better medicine — and it's subsidised

image.altText: An aerial view of streets in suburban Melbourne, on a sunny day.

items.synopsis: Some suburbs are now seeing as much as a 14.4 per cent growth in median house value.

title.children: Some Australian suburbs are experiencing another property market boom. Is yours one of them?

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with an unidentified child

items.synopsis: The suspected murder of Perth mother Georgia Lyall, believed by police to be at the hands of her ex-partner, leaves those who knew her grieving and in disbelief.

title.children: 'You deserved so much more than this': Tributes flow for victim of suspected murder-suicide

image.altText: A row of heavily armed men in camo gear, carrying guns

items.synopsis: Yevgeny Prigozhin's attempted mutiny last month might have failed in Russia, but in Mali and a handful of other African nations, the Wagner Group's influence — and reign of terror — is expanding.

title.children: Over five horrific days, armed Russian mercenaries tortured an African town. Is this Wagner's future?

image.altText: An archaeological dig site with ruins visible and deep holes and people standing around

items.synopsis: Previously only referred to in ancient Roman texts, the long-lost theatre of emperor Nero is found under a garden in Rome.

title.children: Ancient Roman ruins of Nero's Theatre discovered under hotel garden

image.altText: Kylie Minogue, wearing a black strappy dress and chunky diamond necklace, smiles on the red carpet

items.synopsis: Australia's princess of pop will star in her first residency, following a run of successes with her recent hit Padam Padam.

title.children: 'Vegas baby!' Kylie Minogue announces first residency

image.altText: A faint blue flame is burning from a gas element on a stainless steel cooktop

items.synopsis: The Victorian government will ban gas connections to new homes and residential subdivisions from January 1 next year.

title.children: Victoria bans gas connections in new homes from 2024

image.altText: A graphic image shows the Metricon logo in front of a house

items.synopsis: More than 60 complaints have been lodged with NSW Fair Trading since March, with Metricon listed on the regulator's complaints register for the last four consecutive months.

title.children: Investigation launched into Australia's top home builder Metricon, as more complaints emerge

image.altText: A sign saying CORONERS COURT on a modern sandstone building

items.synopsis: The inquest heard that the mother's heart rate was monitored instead of the baby's for nearly 30 minutes. It also heard the most senior doctor rostered on that night was a first-year obstetrics registrar who didn't have experience in handling a complicated urgent assisted delivery.

title.children: 'Fundamental and tragic error': Baby's death at Adelaide hospital could have been prevented, coroner finds

image.altText: Jason Sudeikis holding an Emmy and wearing a suit on stage

items.synopsis: The awards show, due to be held in September, could be delayed until 2024 due to ongoing actor and writer strikes, Variety reports.

title.children: Emmy Awards postponed for the first time since 9/11

image.altText: A smiling man in a suit and tie

items.synopsis: Lawyers for war veteran Heston Russell accuse the ABC of engaging in an "inexcusable abuse of power" by publishing "false articles" before using a "PR machine" to defend the journalism.

title.children: ABC accused of engaging in 'inexcusable abuse of power' by publishing 'false articles' about war veteran

image.altText: Girl in silhouette watches sunset from rocks

items.synopsis: The United Nations secretary-general delivers a dramatic speech warning the heatwaves searing much of the northern hemisphere have been a "disaster" for the planet. An emerging El Niño means it may be just the start.

title.children: United Nations warns of 'global boiling' as July set to shatter heat records

image.altText: Lloyd Austin and Rchard Marle at a press conference.

items.synopsis: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin and Secretary of State Antony Blinken are here for meetings with their counterparts ahead of joint AUSMIN talks that are likely to feature climate change, regional geopolitics, AUKUS and expanding defence ties between Australia and the United States.

title.children: US defense secretary accuses China of 'bullying behaviour' ahead of high-level talks in Brisbane

image.altText: Aerial view of the Port Arthur historic site, Tasmania.

items.synopsis: A research paper finds World Heritage sites, protected for their unique natural or cultural values, are under extreme threat from climate change and risk being de-listed if those values are eroded.

title.children: 'Water is getting into these buildings': Sea level rises are hurting our World Heritage sites, research finds

image.altText: Blue shadows surrounds several people holding cups lit by candles.

items.synopsis: Anti-death penalty activists have denounced the execution, days after another, and say there are fears a third prisoner could be killed next week.

title.children: 'Against evidence and better judgement': Singapore executes first woman in 19 years

image.altText: a woman smiles into the distance next to a cane field

items.synopsis: For a long time, the eldest son has been seen as the natural successor to a family farm. But there is change on the horizon.

title.children: 'Succession is a real life drama': Are the patriarchal tides turning for farm daughters?

image.altText: The logo of Greyhound Racing SA on a wall.

items.synopsis: Greyhound Racing SA lays 12 charges against two registered industry participants following reports by the ABC about alleged animal mistreatment.

title.children: Two people charged with greyhound mistreatment following ABC report

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up his ballot while voting in the election that makes him the prime minister

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will further escalate a high-stakes political stand-off with the Greens, in a move that could send Australians to an early, double-dissolution election.

title.children: PM stepping closer to early election trigger as housing battle with Greens escalates

image.altText: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese in a blue collared shirt and Akubra hat, standing outside and looking down.

items.synopsis: A report from the Productivity Commission has exposed – without spelling it out – an odd shortcoming in the Albanese government's sales pitch for its Voice proposal, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: This week we saw an odd shortcoming in Albanese's sales pitch for the Voice

image.altText: Two men in hats crouch in front of a black bull

items.synopsis: A 12-month-old Angus bull has become the most expensive ever sold in Australia — for $360,000.

title.children: Bull breaks auction record, selling for more than a country town home

image.altText: Man swinging golf club on golf green, wearing only shoes and a hat

items.synopsis: Darwin naturists revealed all on the city's coldest day since 1942 in a celebration of body positivity and amateur golf.

title.children: Nude golf day 'not a sex thing' as bodies, scars help players tell their stories

image.altText: A man in a suit sits at a desk with a microphone in front of an American flag.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump asked a staffer to delete camera footage at his Florida estate in an effort to obstruct the investigation into his possession of classified documents, according to an updated indictment.

title.children: Trump accused of asking staffer to delete camera footage in Florida classified documents case

image.altText: A man with long wearing a white sweater playing a guitar and singing into a microphone with a dark background

items.synopsis: He was a founding member of the iconic American band known for favourites such as Take It to the Limit, Take It Easy and The Best of My Love.

title.children: Eagles bassist Randy Meisner dies aged 77

image.altText: Mannequin of a middle-aged woman on a hospital bed.

items.synopsis: When Elizabeth arrives at hospital she is screaming and writhing in pain, as the fully animated mannequin plays her part in training bush nurses for real life emergencies.

title.children: Meet Elizabeth, the AI patient helping to train nurses for real life bush emergencies

image.altText: Coronavirus

items.synopsis: Here's a quick wrap of the COVID-19 news and case numbers from each Australian jurisdiction from the past week.

title.children: The latest COVID-19 news and case numbers from around the states and territories

image.altText: A South African player falls to the ground while being challenged by an Argentine opponent at the Women's World Cup.

items.synopsis: Two late goals brought Argentina back into the contest, but neither side could find a winner in the Group G clash across the Tasman in Dunedin/Ōtepoti.

title.children: Argentina, South Africa play out thrilling World Cup draw

image.altText: A young female tennis player, wearing a brown visor, lavender shorts,  brown top, plays on a tennis court..

items.synopsis: This athlete wants to achieve a lot. But the 19-year-old says if she keeps working towards her goals, then "anything is possible."

title.children: Courtney picked up a tennis racket about a year ago. Now she is representing Australia

image.altText: Sinead O'connor wearing a priests black outfit with a cross holding a microphone and smiling

items.synopsis: Police say singer Sinéad O'Connor was found unresponsive at an address in London and pronounced dead at the scene.

title.children: Sinéad O'Connor was found unresponsive at London address, police say death is not being treated as suspicious

image.altText: An overhead shot of university students sitting in a lecture theatre.

items.synopsis: Universities have told a Senate inquiry it is not "feasible" to attempt to detect AI cheats, instead saying the sector will have to overhaul its entire approach to teaching to ensure students actually learn what they are meant to.

title.children: Universities say AI cheats can't be beaten, moving away from attempts to block AI

image.altText: Sam Kerr looks to her left as she watches the Matildas warm up for their World Cup match against Nigeria.

items.synopsis: The Matildas are still no closer to knowing whether Sam Kerr will be available to face Canada in their crucial final group match, as their World Cup campaign hangs in the balance following the loss to Nigeria.

title.children: Matildas on a knife-edge as they hope for Sam Kerr's World Cup return against Canada

image.altText: A composite image of two Australian players looking determined, and one Nigerian player looking triumphant.

items.synopsis: Australia's loss to Nigeria sets up a must-win clash against Canada in Melbourne on Monday — these are the five things we learned from the day of play.

title.children: Five quick hits — Matildas face do-or-die clash against Canada as Australia fails to capitalise on early dominance
